titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, Lewis E 151: Religious manual
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

msIdentifier.collection: John Frederick Lewis Collection of European Manuscripts

msContents.summary: This is a collection of offices, followed by seven short unidentified texts.

supportDesc.extent: ii+101+i; 142 x 105 mm bound to 149 x 103 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Foliation in Roman numerals, red ink, upper center; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto; references in this record are to the modern foliation in pencil; one insert not included in foliation, between folios 69 and 70

layoutDesc.layout: One added leaf in front, eleven at the end; some musical notation on 4 occasionally 5 line staves; 1 column of 16 lines; prickings visible on some folios

decoDesc.decoNote: Capitals in red and blue; musical staves and rubrication in red

binding.p: Original blind stamped calf over wooden boards, with unusual stamps of a running hound and the evangelical lion of Saint Mark on the top cover, with clasp, in maroon morocco case

history.provenance: Belonged to a Dominican nunnery of the Holy Cross, possibly at Asperg, Württemberg; note dated 1498 concerning two nuns: Maria Holtzschüchin and Agnes Rüdolfin; note dated 1591 by the nunnery's confessor, Fr. Mathias Dillinganus, and another early 17th century note by his successor, Fr. R. Han; later in a South German nunnery; Rush C. Hawkins sale, New York, March 21, 1887, no. 1548; sale by Thomas Birch's sons, Philadelphia, Oct. 12, 1887, no. 401; W. J. Gilbert, St. Louis; his sale, Philadelphia, June 7, 1910, no. 244; (directly to?) John Frederick Lewis, Philadelphia; given by his widow, Anne Baker Lewis, to the Free Library of Philadelphia in 1936.
